title: Camille Thoman
text:
Camille Thoman is an English director and writer best known for her 2017 thriller "<a href="You%20Were%20Never%20Here">Never Here</a>""," starring Mireille Enos and Sam Shepard. Her documentary "The Longest Game" premiered on PBS in May 2018 "." Thoman's solo performance pieces have been performed by her at <a href="Young%20Vic">The Young Vic</a> in London and broadcast on the BBC.
Early career.
Thoman began her career doing physical theatre in the UK. Her solo performances pieces toured the UK and were performed at <a href="Young%20Vic">The Young Vic</a> in London, <a href="Battersea%20Arts%20Centre">Battersea Arts Center</a>, The <a href="Rondo%20Theatre">Rondo</a> in Bath, <a href="Unity%20Theatre%2C%20Liverpool">The Unity Theatre</a> in Liverpool and the <a href="Komedia">Komedia</a> in Brighton. She also took her work to the <a href="Edinburgh%20Festival%20Fringe">Edinburgh Fringe Festival</a> where her devised piece Numb received a <a href="Total%20Theatre%20Award">Total Theatre Award</a> Nomination. Numb was also featured on the BBC program Edinburgh nights. In 2006 she made her short film "<a href="Falling%20Objects">Falling Objects</a>," starring <a href="Golden%20Globe%20Award">Golden Globe nominee</a> <a href="Mireille%20Enos">Mireille Enos</a>, Oscar-winner <a href="Timothy%20Hutton">Timothy Hutton</a>, <a href="Academy%20Award">Oscar</a>-winner <a href="Melissa%20Leo">Melissa Leo</a> and <a href="Mad%20Men">"Mad Men"'s</a> Kevin Rahm.
Never Here.
"<a href="Never%20Here">Never Here</a>" is a 2017 thriller about an artist who photographs strangers. When disturbing events lead her to suspect that someone is watching her, boundaries blur between crime and art, the watcher and the watched. "Never Here" stars <a href="Mireille%20Enos">Mireille Enos</a>, <a href="Sam%20Shepard">Sam Shepard</a>, <a href="Vincent%20Piazza">Vincent Piazza</a>, <a href="Goran%20Vi%C5%A1nji%C4%87">Goran Visnjic</a>, <a href="Nina%20Arianda">Nina Arianda</a> and <a href="Desmin%20Borges">Desmin Borges</a>. "Never Here" was released in the US in October 2017.
